pr_title: Add srcset_image and picture tags for responsive images
pr_body:
Based on [RFC 71](https://github.com/wagtail/rfcs/pull/71) – add `srcset_image` and `picture` tags for responsive images to Wagtail. Fixes #285, #5289. Implementation started by @PaarthAgarwal, completed by @thibaudcolas.

## Demo

To try this out,

- With Jinja: https://github.com/wagtail/bakerydemo/pull/455
- With DTL: https://github.com/wagtail/bakerydemo/pull/456

Here are copy-pasteable examples of the tags demonstrating the most common use cases:

```html
{% srcset_image my_image fill-{100x150,200x300} sizes="80vw" %}
{% picture my_image format-{avif,jpeg} %}
{% picture my_image format-{avif,jpeg} fill-{100x150,200x300} sizes="80vw" %}
```

## Implementation

There are a lot of high-level implementation choices that are important:

- Quite a bit of the images rendering logic is in `wagtail.images.models`, as new wrapper classes (and a big addition to `Filter`). This is so we can reuse said logic between the Jinja and DTL implementations
- Those wrapper classes support rendering the output of `srcset_image` and `picture` as HTML, as well as accessing the renditions. This is to match how the `image` tag works.
- For DTL, we reuse the same `image` parser function for all three image template tags. The difference between the tags on parsing logic is very minimal, so it felt appropriate.
- For renditions with multiple sizes – we define the `srcset` attribute in the order of the format operations provided by the developer. It’s important they have the order in sync with the content of the `sizes` attribute. 
- For renditions with multiple formats – I chose to have the tag always output in the same order, no matter the order the formats are requested in. This is because we should be able to always determine the correct order (always prefer AVIF over anything else, WEBP over anything but AVIF, etc).

## TODOs

- Once this is merged, I’d recommend another PR to update more of the docs to switch to the `picture` tag. 
- And we’ll also want to update the bakerydemo to the new tags – but this can only be merged once v5.2 is released.

## Checklist

-   [x] Do the tests still pass?[^1]
-   [x] Does the code comply with the style guide?
-   [x] For Python changes: Have you added tests to cover the new/fixed behaviour?
-   ~~[ ] For front-end changes: Did you test on all of Wagtail’s supported environments?[^2]~~
-   [x] For new features: Has the documentation been updated accordingly?

```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 12, 7, 29, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1292134539, 'comment_body': 'I’d suggest removing this for now for the sake of simplicity. Can always be added later.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 12, 7, 36, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1292134838, 'comment_body': 'Seems to be a double up of the one above?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 12, 7, 37, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1300146384, 'comment_body': '```suggestion

```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 13, 53, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'laymonage', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1300148929, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
from django.core.exceptions import ImproperlyConfigured
from django.template.base import FilterExpression
from django.template.loader import render_to_string
from django.urls import NoReverseMatch
```

and there's also a missing import:

```py
from django.conf import settings
```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 13, 55, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'laymonage', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1300151745, 'comment_body': '```suggestion
            resolved_attrs = {
                'srcset': ",".join([f"{rendition.url} {rendition.width}w" for rendition in renditions])
            }
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 8, 21, 13, 57, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'laymonage', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1352523863, 'comment_body': 'would be great to have an example of the outputs the new tags produce, especially for people like me who take forever to wrap their head around srcsets and the various sizes', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 10, 13, 22, 49, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'zerolab', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1354589988, 'comment_body': 'Good point! I might revisit this after this PR is merged if that’s ok with you? I’d generally like to add much more documentation about those tags, as their usage will lead to massive performance and carbon emissions improvements.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 11, 9, 47, 19, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1361382046, 'comment_body': "```suggestion
You can generate multiple renditions of the same image from Python using the native `get_renditions()` method. It will accept any number of 'specification' strings or `Filter` instances, and will generate a set of matching renditions much more efficiently than generating each one individually. For example:
```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 17, 0, 24, 31, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1361982889, 'comment_body': 'Not mandatory, but since we only ever expect one `{` and one `}` (at least for now), might be best to use `maxsplit` so it doesn't crash here when it tries to unpack the result into two variables if there are more than `{` or `}`:

```suggestion
                prefix, options_suffixed = segment.split("{", maxsplit=1)
                options_pattern, suffix = options_suffixed.rsplit("}", maxsplit=1)
```

Use `rsplit` instead of `split` for the `}`.

This way, it'll be easier if we want to raise e.g. syntax error because one of the filter spec will contain `{` or `}` in the string.

Edit: turns out this isn't enough, you'll also need to change the following lines:

https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/blob/e2e013066297faaa86714ead5aa4870ab593410f/wagtail/images/image_operations.py#L150

https://github.com/wagtail/wagtail/blob/e2e013066297faaa86714ead5aa4870ab593410f/wagtail/images/image_operations.py#L265

Happy to revisit this in a separate PR!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 17, 11, 44, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'laymonage', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1362011118, 'comment_body': "Just want to flag that I find this a bit surprising. I was thinking if you only specify one format, you'd still be able to have that one format in the dictionary.

```suggestion
```", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 17, 12, 9, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'laymonage', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1362015143, 'comment_body': 'And then in here, we can check for `len(self.formats) == 1` instead:

```suggestion
        # If there aren’t multiple formats, render a vanilla img tag with srcset.
        if len(self.formats) == 1:
            return mark_safe(f"<picture>{super().__html__()}</picture>")
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 17, 12, 12, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'laymonage', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1362052027, 'comment_body': 'Nit:

```suggestion
To render an image in multiple formats, you can use the `picture` tag:
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 17, 12, 42, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'laymonage', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1362054509, 'comment_body': 'With this sentence, and the fact that the `Picture` class extends the `ResponsiveImage` class, maybe we should document the "Multiple formats" (plus the examples of `picture` with multiple sizes) _after_ the "Responsive images" section?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 17, 12, 44, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'laymonage', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1362207134, 'comment_body': 'Good idea. Will add this to documentation goals for feature freze.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 10, 17, 14, 19, 23, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1378581541, 'comment_body': 'I decided to not have responsive images docs before "multiple formats" docs in the end – as I believe for most people it’ll be simpler to adopt "multiple formats" than "responsive images". It’s just harder to understand how srcset and sizes works compared to defining which formats to use. Happy for you to tell me I’m wrong though if you’d still like to see this changed', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 11, 1, 9, 39, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'thibaudcolas', 'type': 'User'}]
